The Organisation structure view appears to use a helper that returns users in the same department and excludes manager roles, which results in an empty list when the lead sits in a different department node than the staff they manage. ```text

sql

I am trying to find a way to allocate programs to existing workers based on their job start date from the Org Structure, or their Hire date (custom profile field).¬† I am using a series of courses for on-boarding, and some staff have been with us for a long time, and I want to be able to see them as overdue in the program rather than as an open or future allocation. I can set up the program and create the dynamic rule for future workers, but I need to apply the correct start dates for the programs to existing staff. It's not feasible to manually adjust each one as there are around 2000 that need to be altered. ¬†The programs documentation does not have any instructions on how to allocate a program retrospectively. Has anyone been successful in using programs like this for existing staff?

ResponsesInList.Title: Programs and retrospective allocation dates
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Deb, With Dynamic Rules, it's not possible to specify different program dates for each user based on custom fields or job start dates, you can only specify a fixed date for the rule or use the program defaults. To manage allocations for existing staff with different dates, you can use the Upload Users functionality, which allows you to specify start, end, and due dates for each user individually (you can use Report Builder to gather the information needed to create the CSV file). Once you‚Äôve processed allocations for existing employees, you can create a Dynamic Rule for allocating new users based on program dates. Just make sure to include conditions so the rules apply only to new users. If this is not a one-off need, you may want to speak with your partner about evaluating a custom development to include the custom field in the Dynamic Rule action, enabling automation. Hope this helps! Cheers, Emilio

// Preserve original text case // Apply color only if tag is in the list if (tagColors.hasOwnProperty(tagText)) { let color = tagColors[tagText]; // Apply custom styling tag.style.setProperty("background-color", color, "important"); tag.style.setProperty("color", "#ffffff", "important"); // White text tag.style.setProperty("border-radius", "50px", "important"); // Pill shape tag.style.setProperty("padding", "6px 12px", "important"); tag.style.setProperty("margin", "3px", "important"); tag.style.setProperty("display", "inline-block", "important"); tag.style.setProperty("font-weight", "bold", "important"); // üîπ FORCE text color (to avoid Moodle overriding it) tag.style.setProperty("text-shadow", "none", "important"); // Remove unwanted shadow tag.style.setProperty("border", "none", "important"); // Remove any unwanted borders tag.style.setProperty("text-transform", "none", "important"); // Ensure correct capitalization } }); } // Function to continuously monitor changes (fix for AJAX filtering & pagination) function watchCatalogueUpdates() { const catalogueContainer = document.querySelector(".tool_catalogue_courses_list"); if (!catalogueContainer) return; const observer = new MutationObserver(function(mutations) { mutations.forEach(function(mutation) { if (mutation.type === "childList" || mutation.type === "subtree") { applyTagStyles(); // Reapply styles immediately when content changes } }); }); // Observe changes in the course list (filters, pagination, AJAX updates, etc.) observer.observe(catalogueContainer, { childList: true, subtree: true }); } // Function to detect AJAX requests and reapply colors function watchAJAXRequests() { const originalOpen = XMLHttpRequest.prototype.open; XMLHttpRequest.prototype.open = function() { this.addEventListener("load", function() { setTimeout(applyTagStyles, 500); // Reapply styles after AJAX request completes }); originalOpen.apply(this, arguments); }; } // Function to handle pagination clicks (next/previous pages) function watchPagination() { document.addEventListener("click", function(event) { if (event.target.closest(".pagination a")) { setTimeout(applyTagStyles, 500); // Short delay to allow new page to load } }); } // Run tag coloring when the page loads setTimeout(() => { applyTagStyles(); watchCatalogueUpdates(); // Detect filtering and pagination changes watchAJAXRequests(); ResponsesInList.Title: Org Structure Managers using catalogue to enrol staff
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Deb, The default name of this role is a bit misleading. It does not share the same permissions as a regular Moodle "Manager", instead, this role is very limited since this role's purpose is to give just enough access at the site level for a user to interact with the "organizational structure / jobs / positions" features of Workplace (so it is not actually a Moodle "Manager"). Therefore, it's missing some key permissions. You might be a little better of assigning the Manager role to those users, but that will also open the door to many other permissions. So some permissions to consider adding to the Org Structure Manager role to allow them to enroll users is moodle/course:view, moodle/course:viewparticipants, moodle/course:enrolreview, moodle/role:assign (aside from what you've already listed: enrol/manual:enrol, enrol/manual:manage) Also, you'd also need to click the "Allow role assignments" tab on the Users - Define Roles page and allow this role to assign the Student role

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Org Structure Managers using catalogue to enrol staff
ResponsesInList.Text: For anyone interested, we have found a simple workaround that works in 4.5 using a plugin called Cohort role syncronization https://moodle.org/plugins/local_cohortrole . The Org Structure Managers and Department lead have been added to a system cohort by dynamic rule and that cohort has been syncronized to theOrg Structure Manager system role. Some of the permissions needed to be adjusted, especially these ones that had to be set to allow: moodle/site:viewparticipants moodle/user:viewalldetails enrol/manual:enrol mod/facetoface:addattendees moodle/course:enrolreview moodle/course:view (view courses without participation) moodle/course:viewparticipants These were the main ones needed, and you can adjust the others like createing or deleting users etc as required. I based the permissions on the non-editing teacher role and then just starting refining it. It doesn't limit the view to only their direct reports, but is limited to them only seeing tenant users. Hopefully this helps someone else that may be struggling with this issue.

ResponsesInList.Title: Custom Pages are an amazing Workplace feature
ResponsesInList.Text: Workplace has a Custom Pages feature that allows a page of Block content to exist outside of a "Course" context . Links to these Custom Pages automatically appear on the navigation menu when set to be visible. This is very powerful as you have the ability to define who can see these custom pages. For example, you can have a page that only Guests can see, another page that only Authenticated Users can see,¬†and you can even make a " Dashboard " that only a specific "Roles" or specific "Users" can see (I made a reporting Dashboard for my one supervisor that only they can see). One tip I wanted to share is how to prevent a Custom page from automatically appearing on the custom menu. (For example, I created a "Learning Center" Custom Page that¬†contains links to two other Custom Pages, but I don't want these two other¬† Custom Pages to appear on the main Navigation menu.) Use the id# located in the Custom Page's URL and insert that number¬† at the end of the code below: /* Hide a specific Custom Page from the Primary Navigation Menu */ .primary-navigation li[data-key="tool_custompage- 21 "] {display: none;}

ResponsesInList.Title: When removing jobs via user upload, if the job is already deleted, it gets added back
ResponsesInList.Text: When deleting jobs using the user upload interface, I've noticed not all jobs are always deleted. If I upload the same job delete csv with the jobdelete1 column, and zero out the jobs previously deleted, they get added back. It seems there is a bug that ignores the column value of 0 or 1 if the job is already deleted, and then adds it back. In my understanding of having a 0 or 1 in the column, a zero should be no action, and a 1 should delete the job. That is my understanding from the documentation, but in reality a 0 is ignored and the job is added back. Anyone else finding this is the case?

ResponsesInList.Title: When removing jobs via user upload, if the job is already deleted, it gets added back
ResponsesInList.Text: I just tested on my WP environment (version 4.4) and here is what I see: Using the following fields, jobs were added for my 4 users: username jobdepartment1 jobposition1 jobstartdate1 jobenddate1 jobdelete1 sampleuser1 sampledept sampleposition 2024-09-23 2025-09-23 0 sampleuser2¬† sampledept sampleposition 2024-09-23 2025-09-23 0 sampleuser3¬† sampledept sampleposition 2024-09-23 2025-09-23 0 sampleuser4¬† sampledept sampleposition 2024-09-23 2025-09-23 0 it did delete a job when using the following fields in a separate CSV; username jobdepartment1 jobposition1 jobdelete1 sampleuser sampledept samplepos 1 I'm not sure the 0 means don't add it back, I think 0 means "ignore the column", and 1 means "do this column's action"... so when you're adding 0s to previous positions that were deleted, then by including them in the CSV in the future I think it makes sense that they are added back in, meaning, the "0" is not a "no action" for the row, but instead a "no action" for the column if that makes sense. So if you want to reuse a CSV, any 1s should remain 1s in future runs of the CSV (and even though it's already deleted, it will simply just look to delete again the next run and if there's nothing to delete then it's just ignored and not added back).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Dynamic Rules - Notification
ResponsesInList.Text: The Dynamic Rules look at courses as a whole so it can automate actions based on various course completion statuses, so it won't include options at the individual activity completion level. Consider these options: Overdue activities : T he Pulse plugin ( https://moodle.org/plugins/mod_pulse ) -- it's capable to send reminders for after specific dates if an activity remains overdue. Since Relative Dates is considered an experimental feature at this time, I do not know if it knows to utilize the student's relative due date or not, but if you create a test course with relative dates enabled and pick an activity with an upcoming due date, then set up this plugin in the course to send an overdue message, you can then enroll a a test user after that due date has passed to see if they will get the message on their respective due date. The Reengagement plugin ( https://moodle.org/plugins/mod_reengagement ) also can send reminders for overdue content. Upcoming activities: Both the plugins mentioned above state they have capabilities to send notifications about upcoming activities. Then, there's the built-in Moodle's Analytics system's model for Upcoming activities due (if it's not there by default, you just click add a New model).¬†This will send emails or Web alerts (depending on how the site admin sets up default Messaging - Notification Preferences for "Insights generated by prediction models") at one of three defined intervals: Upcoming week, upcoming 3 days, or upcoming fortnight. With that said, it wont provide a list of the activities,¬†instead it directs users to the dashboard 's timeline where they can see/access the upcoming activities. To give it a try with a test user, it's rather simple to set up and get going - while you are testing this out you can turn off these notifications at the site level, then edit the preferences of your test users and enable it just for them so only get that email/web alert. Another option to see the data it will generate for the test users¬†is to go the Analytics Models admin settings page, find the upcoming activities due model and select the test users from the dropdown in the Insights column (they will only appear here once the analytic model has finished running for the interval) to see if they have any upcoming items due data generated, or next to that dropdown select "Actions - Insight Report" and then the particular user to see a report of the data. These are the approaches that I have used in my institution so just wanted to share in case you see any value in these options.
